Craig ... there's quite a few dups of this ... are you letting them build up? :)

I think I might have found the problem here
It looks like you just finished "jarring" the xsd plugin, where the XML catelog
cache resides.  I don't think the XML catelog handles loading from a jarred plugin

Keith, can you look into this.  This sounds like the XSD model Crimson
problem... can you confirm?

The first few lines in the stack trace is quite telling.

	at javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.xsd.util.XSDResourceImpl.getDocument
(XSDResourceImpl.java:238)
	at org.eclipse.xsd.util.XSDResourceImpl.doLoad
(XSDResourceImpl.java:394)


This is a dup of [Bug 101744] Use InputSource instead of InputStream when 
parsing.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 101744 ***
*** Bug 100854 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 91712 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I am  still getting this exception while using Sun JRE.

This problem is fixed in 101744 in the XSD model.
You should use the 2.1 release of XSD, EMF, and SDO.
The WTP builds have been updated to use this version.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 101744 ***
